thread.title: Don't be scared: Where to eat, drink and party on Oct. 31
thread.title_full: Don't be scared: Where to eat, drink and party on Oct. 31 - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Don't be scared: Where to eat, drink and party on Oct. 31
text:
Photo: Alison Cook Image 1 of / 9 9 REVIVAL MARKET
What: Fall Festival When: 5-9 p.m. Oct. 31 Where: 550 Heights What to expect: Pumpkin-carving and costume contests, live music, face-painting and door prizes Tickets: $35, includes choice of burger or hot dog, two drink tickets and a cookie Family friendly: yes, tickets are $10 Information: 713-880-8463 REVIVAL MARKET
What: Fall Festival When: 5-9 p.m. Oct. 31 Where: 550 Heights What to expect: Pumpkin-carving and costume contests, live music, face-painting and door prizes Tickets: $35, includes choice of burger ... more Image 2 of 9 PROHIBITION SUPPERCLUB & BAR
What: The Masque of the Red Death featuring the Moonlight Dolls When: 7 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. Oct. 29-31 Where: 1008 Prairie What to expect: dinner and a show; costumes required Tickets: purchased separately; show tickets start at $10; dinner is $45 Information: 281-940-4636 PROHIBITION SUPPERCLUB & BAR
What: The Masque of the Red Death featuring the Moonlight Dolls When: 7 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. Oct. 29-31 Where: 1008 Prairie What to expect: dinner and a show; costumes required Tickets: ... more Image 3 of 9 JULEP
What: Shipwrecked! When: 4 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: 1919 Washington What to expect: live music, drink specials and a shipwrecked-themed costume contest that will require contestants to walk the plank Tickets: $5 donation that will benefit Arthritis Foundation Information: 713-869-4383 JULEP
What: Shipwrecked! When: 4 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: 1919 Washington What to expect: live music, drink specials and a shipwrecked-themed costume contest that will require contestants to walk the ... more Image 4 of 9 THE SPAGHETTI WAREHOUSE
What: adult costume contest and party When: 9 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: 901 Commerce What to expect: drink specials and a $1,000 grand prize Tickets: free Information: 713-229-9715 THE SPAGHETTI WAREHOUSE
What: adult costume contest and party When: 9 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: 901 Commerce What to expect: drink specials and a $1,000 grand prize Tickets: free Information: 713-229-9715 Photo: Sharon Steinmann, Chronicle Image 5 of 9 MONTROSE CRAWL
What: a 12-stop pub crawl on a 1/2-mile section of Westheimer When: 7 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: Westheimer between Dunlavy and Montrose What to expect: drink specials and multiple costume contests The stops: Poison Girl, Pistolero's, the Free Press Graveyard, Boondocks, Stone's Throw, Etro Lounge, Catbirds, Royal Oak, Doc's Motorworks, El Real, Hay Merchant and Slick Willie's Tickets: no cover, no drink minimums Information: montrosecrawl.com MONTROSE CRAWL
What: a 12-stop pub crawl on a 1/2-mile section of Westheimer When: 7 p.m.-midnight Oct. 31 Where: Westheimer between Dunlavy and Montrose What to expect: drink specials and multiple costume ... more Image 6 of 9 FRIGHT NIGHT IN THE HEIGHTS
What: a Heights pub crawl with bars themed after classic horror films When: 7 p.m.-1 a.m. Oct. 31 Where: Big Star (1005 W. 19th), D&T Drive Inn (1307 Enid), Johnny's Gold Brick (2518 Yale), Lei Low (6412 N. Main), Southern Goods (632 W. 19th) and Town in City Brewing Company (1125 W. Calvacade) What to expect: a free shuttle will take partygoers to their next stop Information: Facebook event page FRIGHT NIGHT IN THE HEIGHTS

Photo: Courtesy Photo/ Facebook Image 8 of 9 MR. PEEPLES
What: Return to the Emerald City When: 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Oct. 31 Where: 1911 Bagby What to expect: four post floors of themed entertainment including a laser light show Information: emeraldcity.com MR. PEEPLES
What: Return to the Emerald City When: 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Oct. 31 Where: 1911 Bagby What to expect: four post floors of themed entertainment including a laser light show Information: emeraldcity.com Photo: Eric Kayne Image 9 of 9 Don't be scared: Where to eat, drink and party on Oct. 31 1 / 9 Back to Gallery Houston restaurants and bars are getting into the spirit of the season with some scary good meals, deals and parties.
Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar is offering an 007-themed Evening of Espionage at 6:30 p.m. Oct. 30 at the River Oaks restaurant and 6:30 p.m. Oct. 31 at its Woodlands and CityCentre locations. The dinner includes dishes such as oysters on the half shell and New York strip with black garlic truffle butter. Each course will include a vodka cocktail pairing. The evening include a prize for the best costume. Cost is $95 per person.
River Oaks: 2405 W. Alabama, 713-520-5959
CityCentre: 788 W. Sam Houston Parkway, 713-827-1120
Woodlands: 1201 Lake Woodlands, 281-362-0103
Spice retailer Vom Fass is hosting a free family friendly Halloween party 11 a.m.-3 p.m. Oct. 31 in its Rice Village parking lot. There will be treats for the youngsters, wood-fired pizza and mocktails. 2424 Times, 832-742-6100
Kids in costume eat free (with the purchase of an adult entree) at all area Pollo Tropical locations on Oct. 31. Find the nearest location here .
The Rainforest Cafe is hosting a Spook-tacular Halloween party at 5 p.m. Oct. 28 at its three Houston-area locations. Costumes are encouraged and the event will include arts and crafts, games and prizes. On Oct. 31, kids in costume eat free (with the purchase of an adult entree), but you'll have to download a special coupon found here .
Galleria: 5015 Westheimer, 713-840-1088
Katy: 5000 Katy Mills Circle, 281-644-6200
Galveston: 5310 Seawall, 409-744-6000
Charivari ’s Transylvanian chef-owner Johan Schuster has created a scary good menu for Halloween. The meal includes roasted garlic and escargot veloute, bone marrow, “bloody” red beet sorbet and pork steak with black garlic mashed potatoes. Dessert will be a pomegranate cobbler with Muenster cheese gelato. Served Oct. 30-31, the meal is $55. 2521 Bagby, 713-521-7231
Humble’s fine dining room Chez Nous is offering its “Hallow’s Eve Food and Wine Convivium” at 7 p.m. Oct. 30. The menu features dishes such as red beet salad with blood oranges, pumpkin pie-spiced torchon of foie gras, black chicken coq au vin and devil’s food cake. Cost is $135 with wine pairings. 217 S. Avenue G, Humble,281-446-6717
Browse the slideshow above to see details on some of H-Town's hottest Halloween parties.
